Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan have bounced back with two convincing performances with the ball.
Bangladesh have won two out of their four matches and are capable of doing in white-ball cricket.
Pakistan will start as the clear favorites but will be wary of what Bangladesh are capable of doing.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Adelaide Oval has been a relatively high-scoring venue with the average first-innings total being 164.
Both pacers and spinners have enjoyed the conditions on offer, accounting for more than 10 wickets across four matches at the venue.
Others: No injury concerns for Bangladesh or Pakistan.
Mohammad Rizwan has not been able to get going in this tournament with only one score in excess of 30 in four outings.
Litton Das comes into the game on the back of a breathtaking 27-ball 60 against India.
Shadab Khan also had a brilliant outing in his previous game, scoring his first T20I fifty against South Africa.
Taskin Ahmed has been the pick of the Bangladesh bowlers in the tournament, taking eight wickets at an average of 13.12.
